name: Group Theory & Symmetry
description: Understanding algebraic structures, symmetry transformations, and their applications in physics and cryptography.

cards.title: Group Axioms & Properties
cards.description: The fundamental properties that define mathematical groups and their structures.
bulletpoints: A group \( G \) is a set with a binary operation \( \cdot \) satisfying four axioms: closure, associativity, identity, and inverses
A group is abelian if \( a \cdot b = b \cdot a \) for all \( a, b \in G \), otherwise it is non-abelian
Examples include \( (\mathbb{Z}, +) \), the symmetric group \( S_n \), and the general linear group \( GL(n, \mathbb{R}) \)

cards.title: Cyclic Groups & Generators
cards.description: Understanding groups generated by a single element.
bulletpoints: A group \( G \) is cyclic if there exists an element \( g \in G \) such that \( G = \{ g^n \mid n \in \mathbb{Z} \} \)
The order of an element \( g \) in \( G \) is the smallest positive integer \( k \) such that \( g^k = e \)
Examples include \( \mathbb{Z}_n = \{ 0, 1, \dots, n-1 \} \) under addition modulo \( n \)

cards.title: Permutation Groups & Symmetric Groups
cards.description: The study of the symmetric group and its role in combinatorics.
bulletpoints: The symmetric group \( S_n \) consists of all permutations of \( n \) elements under composition
Every permutation can be written as a product of disjoint cycles
The alternating group \( A_n \) consists of all even permutations, forming a normal subgroup of \( S_n \)

cards.title: Dihedral Groups & Rotational Symmetry
cards.description: Exploring the group of symmetries of regular polygons.
bulletpoints: The dihedral group \( D_n \) consists of \( 2n \) elements: \( n \) rotations and \( n \) reflections
Elements satisfy \( r^n = e \) and \( s^2 = e \) with the relation \( s r s = r^{-1} \)
Used in chemistry, crystallography, and robotics for symmetry analysis

cards.title: Lie Groups & Continuous Symmetries
cards.description: Studying continuous transformation groups in physics and geometry.
bulletpoints: A Lie group is a smooth manifold with a differentiable group operation
Examples include the special orthogonal group \( SO(n) \) and the unitary group \( U(n) \)
Lie groups describe fundamental symmetries in quantum mechanics and general relativity

cards.title: Normal Subgroups & Quotient Groups
cards.description: Understanding subgroup structure and factorization in groups.
bulletpoints: A subgroup \( N \) of \( G \) is normal if \( gNg^{-1} = N \) for all \( g \in G \)
The quotient group \( G/N \) consists of left cosets of \( N \), forming a new group
Examples include \( \mathbb{Z}/n\mathbb{Z} \), fundamental in modular arithmetic and homomorphisms

cards.title: Group Homomorphisms & Isomorphisms
cards.description: Mapping one group structure to another while preserving operations.
bulletpoints: A homomorphism \( \phi: G \to H \) satisfies \( \phi(a \cdot b) = \phi(a) \cdot \phi(b) \) for all \( a, b \in G \)
An isomorphism is a bijective homomorphism, meaning \( G \cong H \) if there exists such a mapping
The kernel \( \ker(\phi) \) and image \( \text{Im}(\phi) \) provide insight into group structure

cards.title: Group Representations & Matrix Groups
cards.description: Describing groups through linear transformations and matrices.
bulletpoints: A group representation is a homomorphism \( \rho: G \to GL(n, \mathbb{C}) \) mapping group elements to invertible matrices
The character of a representation is the trace function \( \chi(g) = \text{tr}(\rho(g)) \)
Applications include quantum mechanics, crystallography, and coding theory

cards.title: Finite Groups & Applications in Cryptography
cards.description: Applying group theory to finite structures used in cryptographic systems.
bulletpoints: Examples of finite groups include \( \mathbb{Z}_p^* \) and the multiplicative group of integers modulo \( p \)
Finite fields \( GF(p^n) \) form the basis of elliptic curve cryptography
RSA encryption and Diffie-Hellman key exchange rely on cyclic groups of prime order

cards.title: Sylow Theorems & Group Factorization
cards.description: Studying subgroup structure in finite groups.
bulletpoints: The Sylow theorems provide conditions for the existence of \( p \)-subgroups in a finite group
A \( p \)-subgroup of \( G \) is a maximal subgroup whose order is a power of prime \( p \)
Applications include classification of simple groups and combinatorial symmetry problems
